intro: Cyphomandra cornucopia, commonly known as the horn of plenty, is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit, resembling a horn or a horned melon, is edible and has a tangy, slightly acidic flavor. The plant is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant appearance and unique fruit shape.
